purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of Justification.

Justification represents the identification and description of the reasons for something. Justifications may be associated with the data to which they apply as well as supporting evidential data for the justifications. For example: a justification may be provided for a product design. Similarly, a justification may be provided for why an activity is needed or was undertaken.

inscope.li: the provision of one or more justifications for something;
specification and identification of what is being justified and in what context;
association of the justification to the supporting evidential data on which it is based.

outscope.li: the data items for which the justification is provided;
the supporting evidential data items on which the justification is based;
general associations of management character handled by other modules, such as assignment of classification, date or time and person or organization to the justification.
